Event: The main event in the post is the author's feeling of apathy and disconnection from their emotions, humor, joys, ambitions, and personality. I'm hoping that someday soon, I'll be able to break free from this funk and find my way back to the person I used to be."

Event: The person is experiencing various symptoms, including weakness, shaking, lack of appetite, hallucinations, vivid dreams, and paranoia, which they believe are caused by Wellbutrin. They are unsure of what to do and want to call their doctor but they are closed. They have had a sudden change in energy levels, feeling more alert and ready to take action shortly after writing the post.
Post: "I'm freaking out, guys! I've been taking Wellbutrin for a few weeks now, and suddenly I'm experiencing all these wild symptoms - weakness, shaking, no appetite, hallucinations, vivid dreams, and paranoia. Like, what the heck is going on?!  I'm supposed to call my doctor, but they're closed, and now I'm feeling this sudden surge of energy and alertness. I don't know what to do! Has anyone else had this experience? Help!" #GAS #Wellbutrin #Anxiety

Event: Severe weight loss, dreaming about ex, SIBO (Small Intestine Bacterial Overgrowth) causing fatigue, brain fog, and depression, losing a drummer for the cover band, living with family again, feeling low and unsure of what to do with time, and having torturous dreams.
Post:
"I'm feeling so lost and uncertain about my future. I recently lost a lot of weight, and I keep having nightmares about my ex. On top of that, I've been diagnosed with SIBO, which is causing me to feel tired, brain fogged, and depressed all the time. To make things worse, I just lost my drummer for my cover band, and I had to move back in with my family. I don't know what to do with my life, and these torturous dreams are haunting me every night. It seems like everything is going wrong in my life."

This post attributes the individual's current difficulties (severe weight loss, nightmares about an ex, SIBO symptoms, loss of a drummer, and living with family again) to their supposed inability to succeed in life. The post suggests that these issues are not just temporary setbacks but rather indicative of a broader pattern of failure and disappointment.
